title: A class of 20 students averaged 66% on examination. Another class of 30 students averaged 56%. What is the average percentage for all student? - Quora

response.answer_text: Let's see. 20 students averaged 66%, which is 0.66. Sum of scores / number of students = 0.66 x/20=0.66 Technically, each student could have a score of 0.66. Whether they did or didn't, the sum of their scores is the same as if they did. So, 20 students x 0.66 = the sum of scores, which is 13.2 If the same thing is done for the population of 30 students we can know the sum of all their scores, which, divided by the sum of the students equals the average score for that population of students. The sum of scores / the sum of the students = the average score per student. (((20)(0.66) + (30)(0.56)) / (20+30))•100=x ((13.2+16.8)/50)•100=x (30/50)(100)=x (0.6)(100)=60% Now, if the population of students was not known, and the averages were summed and then divided by 2 the answer would be ((.66+0.56)/2)•100=x (1.22/2)(100)=x (0.61)(100)=61% But this would only be an estimate. However, since the populations are known, the average for the population can be calculated as 60%, not just estimated as 61%. Does this make sense?

Someone else has already answered this question correctly, so I'll tell you how I did it. This is kind of a cheat answer and will not work most of the time. What would the answer to your question be if both classes had 20 people? It should just be right between 56% and 66%, right? Since both classes take up half of the total students, the answer should just be a straight average of their test scores. However, both classes do not have 20 people. The class that scored 56% has 30 people, 3/5 of the students. So they should have a 3/5 “pull” towards their scores, as opposed to the 1/2 pull described earlier. So what's between 56 and 66, but swayed 3/5 towards the 56 side? 60%.

A class of 20 students averaged 66% on examination We know Sum of percent = percentage × number of students Sum of percentage of 20 students = 66% × 20 = 1320 Another class of 30 students averaged 56%. Sum of percentage of 30 students = 56% × 30 = 1680 Sum of percentage of 50 students = 1320 + 1680 = 3000 Average percentage for all 50 students = Sum of percentage of 50 students/50 = 3000/50 = 60% The average percentage for all students is 60% Answer : the average percentage for all students is 60%

Class of 20 students have an average percentage of 66%. That is, (sum of % of 20 students)/20 = 66%Therefore, (sum of % of 20 students) = 1320 Similarly, for the class of 30 students, we can say, (sum of % of 30 students) = 1680 Average % for all 50 students is,= (sum of % of 50 students)/50=((sum of % of 20) + (sum of % of 30))/50=(1320 + 1680)/50= 3000/50= 60%

The difference between the percentages of the two classes is 10%. Now divide it in the ratio of no of students in each class i.e. 10 in 3:2 which yield 6 and 4. Add 4 _Result corresponding to higher quantity_ to 56 _Percentage corresponding to lower quantity_ or subtract 6 _Result corresponding to lower quantity_ from 66 __Percentage corresponding to higher quantity_, both of them makes 60 as answer It's quite different and difficult but can be proved easily

Easier way, take 66 X. 4 and add it to 56 X. 6, which is to say 26.4 Plus 33.6, whose sum is 60. 40% of the students (20 of 50) averaged 66%, while 60% (30 of 50) averaged 56%. So, 66. x .4 Plus 56 X. 6 is the solving equivalent for the average score.
